subject: Cooking
title: Stress Eating: Cortisol's Appetite
description: A fast breakdown of Stress Eating: Cortisol's Appetite for builders.

hook.text: Under deadline pressure, you reach for chips, not carrots. Cortisol is making that choice for you.

buildup.text: Chronic stress elevates cortisol, a hormone that increases appetite ‚Äî especially for high-calorie foods.

discovery.text: Cortisol redirects the brain's focus toward calorie-dense foods that provide quick energy for 'survival.'

twist.text: This system evolved for physical threats like predators. Modern stress is mental ‚Äî but the body can't tell.

climax.text: High-fat comfort food actually lowers cortisol temporarily, reinforcing the stress-eating loop.

punchline.text: Stress eating isn't weakness. It's a survival reflex misfiring.

quiz.question: What hormone drives increased appetite during chronic stress?
